snippet: The Wanxiang Group, a Chinese auto parks manufacturer, has won the bidding for A123 Systems, a bankrupt car battery maker that figured prominently in the Obama administration’s push for electric vehicles.
abstract: The Wanxiang Group, a Chinese auto parks manufacturer, has won the bidding for A123 Systems, a bankrupt car battery maker that figured prominently in the Obama administration’s push for electric vehicles.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

lead_paragraph: The Wanxiang Group, a Chinese auto parks manufacturer, has won the bidding for A123 Systems, a bankrupt car battery maker that figured prominently in the Obama administration’s push for electric vehicles, The New York Times reports. Wanxiang will pay $256 million for all A123 assets save businesses tied to the United States government and military; a small energy company based in Illinois will claim those with a $2.2 million bid. Read more »

headline.main: Chinese Car Parts Maker Wins Bidding for A123 Systems
